chatbot.title: Cancer Detection Assistant
chatbot.description: Ask questions about cancer, upload scans for analysis, or get information about symptoms and treatments.
chatbot.inputPlaceholder: Ask about cancer diagnosis, treatment options, or upload a scan for analysis...
chatbot.welcomeMessage: Hello! I'm your Cancer Assistant. How can I help you today?
chatbot.welcomeDescription: I'm specialized in cancer-related topics only. I can help you understand cancer detection, diagnosis, treatment options, and preventive measures. Please note that I cannot provide general medical advice or discuss non-cancer related health topics.
chatbot.cancerTopicsOnly: I'm specialized in cancer-related topics only. Please ask me questions about cancer diagnosis, treatments, symptoms, or preventive measures. If you need general medical advice, please consult with a healthcare professional.
chatbot.uploadMedicalImagesOnly: Please upload only medical images (JPEG, PNG, DICOM) for cancer-related analysis.
chatbot.uploadMedicalImage: Upload a medical image for cancer analysis
chatbot.fileAnalysisMessage: I've received your medical image "{filename}". I'll analyze it for any potential cancer indicators.
chatbot.defaultResponse: I'm sorry, I couldn't generate a response. Please try asking a different cancer-related question.

help.title: Help & Support
help.subtitle: Find answers to common questions or get in touch with our support team.
help.noFaqsFound: No FAQs found matching your search.
help.supportRequestConfirmation: We've received your request and will get back to you soon!

faq.accuracyQuestion: How accurate is the cancer detection?
faq.accuracyAnswer: Our cancer detection system utilizes advanced AI algorithms trained on large datasets of medical images. The accuracy typically ranges from 85-95% depending on the type of scan and quality of the image. However, all results should be verified by healthcare professionals.
faq.interpretationQuestion: How do I interpret the scan results?
faq.interpretationAnswer: Scan results include a classification (Normal or Abnormal) along with a confidence percentage. If a scan is classified as Abnormal, you should consult with a healthcare professional for further diagnosis. The system may also provide biomarkers identified in the image and recommendations for next steps.
faq.sharingQuestion: Can I share my scan results with my doctor?
faq.sharingAnswer: Yes, you can download your scan results from the scan details page and share them with your healthcare provider. We recommend discussing all results with medical professionals regardless of the outcome.
faq.imageTypesQuestion: What types of images can I upload?
faq.imageTypesAnswer: Currently, our system supports common medical imaging formats including JPEG, PNG, and DICOM files. For best results, ensure the images are clear, well-lit, and properly focused on the area of interest.
faq.dataProtectionAnswer: We take data security very seriously. All your personal information and scan images are encrypted and stored securely. We comply with healthcare data regulations and never share your data with third parties without your explicit consent.
